timeline.message:
Improve performance for loading files

- Performance improvements around groups
- Remove detection of duplicate ID when inserting entries (it's not really possible to create two entries with the same except if you use `setId` manually)
- Remove detection of duplicate bibtex keys when opening a file (the result was not used and we have a integrity check for it)
- Use EnumMap instead of HashMap to cache fields as keywords (which is only used for Keyword and Groups fields anyway)
- Fix bug where latex code was displayed in the maintable
- Lazy init of source tab

timeline.bodyText: Why is this class necessary? I don't see any advantage of the internal java ones
timeline.author: Siedlerchr

replies.bodyText: It's about a factor two faster than the streams solution.
replies.author: tobiasdiez

replies.bodyText:
Can you just add a JavaDoc, please?
Would it be possible to add a performance test? So that if we replace this by something with promising performance (e.g., Goldman Sach's Collections), we can easily check which one is faster.
replies.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText: This is not related to this PR, is it?
timeline.author: koppor

replies.bodyText: Not directly...was added by intellj automatically.

timeline.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText: This is a kind of taste, isn't it? - Would assume that the Builder pattern would be preferred.
timeline.author: koppor

replies.bodyText: Builder pattern for a constructor with one argument seems a bit overkill, don't you think?
replies.author: tobiasdiez

timeline.author: koppor

timeline.bodyText:
Wasn't the samentics of "InternalField" that is a field introduced by JabRef? (The class should be ranamed to JabRefSuperPowerFields (when going extreme).
OWNER and TIMESTAMP are "normal" BibTeX fields - just introdced by JabRef.
If we move GROUPS to StandardField, we should move the other two, too.
@stefan-kolb What's your take on this?
timeline.author: koppor
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -12,7 +12,6 @@
 public enum InternalField implements Field {
     OWNER("owner"),
     TIMESTAMP("timestamp", FieldProperty.DATE),
-    GROUPS("groups"),

replies.bodyText: I now moved all three (group, owner, timestamp) to standard fields. They need to be grouped with the other fields in one enum to use the power of the enummap. Now the "StandardField" refers to a field that is a normal field for JabRef.
replies.author: tobiasdiez

timeline.bodyText: The comment also states, it should left in InternalFields.
timeline.author: koppor
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -124,7 +124,10 @@
     YEARFILED("yearfiled"),
     MR_NUMBER("mrnumber"),
     XDATA("xdata", FieldProperty.MULTIPLE_ENTRY_LINK),
-    XREF("xref", FieldProperty.SINGLE_ENTRY_LINK);
+    XREF("xref", FieldProperty.SINGLE_ENTRY_LINK),
+
+    // JabRef-specific fields

timeline.bodyText: I would put the class in a seperate .java class. This would also enable testing with ...Test.java files.
timeline.author: koppor

replies.bodyText: This is more an implementation detail which shouldn't exposed to the outside world in my opinion. Moreover, private variables are used which makes extraction awkward.
replies.author: tobiasdiez
